entry.title: Alldayeveryday.com
entry.content:
Alldayeveryday is a creative agency in Alphabet City. Its website includes an art/fashion blog, a list of credentials and creative services, and even an online shop.

Worked on the Allday siteâ€™s back end developing methods for Mongo models. Wrote tests for these methods.

Techs used: - Ruby on Rails - Mongoid - Rspec

Alldayeveryday.com was originally published by Daniel Daugherty at Daniel Daugherty on July 31, 2014.

entry.title: Alldayeveryday Tumblr
entry.content:
Renovated the Alldayeveryday tumblr to be consistent and clean in its styling.

Techs used: - Sass - HTML5/CSS3

Alldayeveryday Tumblr was originally published by Daniel Daugherty at Daniel Daugherty on July 31, 2014.

entry.title: MovieMatch
entry.content:
MovieMatch is a movie-going suggestion app. Search in-theatre movies by genre, actor, director, etc. The just sign in and answer a few questions to get % matches for movies you should see in theatres.

This app was built with the following techs: - AngularJS - Twitter Bootstrap - HTML5/CSS3 - PassportJS - MongoDB - Node/Express - RottenTomatoes API - omdb API

MovieMatch was originally published by Daniel Daugherty at Daniel Daugherty on July 31, 2014.

entry.title: Skytunes
entry.content:
Skytunes is a weather-based playist generator powered by SoundCloud. Just answer a few questions about the weather near you, and Skytunes will generate a unique playlist from the weather info and genre you specify.

This app was built with the following techs: - AngularJS - Twitter Bootstrap - HTML5/CSS3 - Node/Express - SoundCloud SDK - Plangular

Skytunes was originally published by Daniel Daugherty at Daniel Daugherty on July 30, 2014.
